articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Catholic Church beatified on Sunday a Polish family of nine, including a new-born baby, who died at the hands of Nazi Germans during World War Two for sheltering a Jewish family from the Holocaust.
articles.title: Catholic Church beatifies Polish family for sheltering Jews

articles.author: Felix Light, Nailia Bagirova
articles.description: Hikmet Hajiev, a foreign policy advisor to Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev, on Saturday denied that Baku had reached a deal with the breakaway province of Nagorno-Karabakh to simultaneously reopen roads to Azerbaijan and Armenia.
articles.title: Azerbaijan denies deal reached to reopen Karabakh-Armenia road

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina has resigned after he was officially confirmed as a candidate in the Indian Ocean Island nation's presidential elections scheduled for November 9, according to the country's constitutional court.
articles.title: Madagascar president resigns ahead of polls in November

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 40 people were killed in an airstrike on a market in southern Khartoum, the local volunteer emergency room said in a statement on Sunday.
articles.title: At least 40 killed in airstrike on southern Khartoum market - local volunteers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday held a phone call with the interim leader of Mali, Assimi Goita, and discussed topics including anti-terrorism efforts and the crisis in Mali's neighbour Niger, the Kremlin said in a statement.
articles.title: Putin discusses Niger crisis with Malian leader Assimi Goita

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Afghan Taliban criticised the closure of its main border crossing with Pakistan this week after clashes between security forces, saying the halt in trade would see heavy losses for businesses.
articles.title: Afghan Taliban criticises closure of main border crossing with Pakistan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The family of a Swedish EU employee detained in Iran have urged the international community to help secure his release after over 500 days of incarceration for alleged spying, his family said on Sunday.
articles.title: Family of Swede detained in Iran calls for international support

articles.author: Jihed Abidellaoui, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Rescuers searched on Sunday for survivors of Morocco's deadliest earthquake in more than six decades, with more than 2,000 people killed by the disaster that has laid waste to villages in the mountains outside Marrakech.
articles.title: Rescuers hunt for survivors of Morocco quake with over 2,000 dead

articles.author: Katya Golubkova, Michel Rose, Manoj Kumar
articles.description: The G20 summit in New Delhi ended on Sunday as India handed over the bloc presidency to Brazil, while both the U.S. and Russia praised a consensus that did not condemn Moscow for the war in Ukraine but called on members to shun the use of force.
articles.title: G20 summit wraps up in New Delhi; Modi calls for a virtual meet in November

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Myanmar has received the first shipment of two Russian Su-30 fighter jets, Charlie Than, Myanmar's trade minister, told the Russian RIA state news agency in remarks published on Sunday.
articles.title: Myanmar receives first shipment of Russia's Su-30 fighter jets - RIA
